title: Mixed Media Installations
tagline: Immersive brand moments blending projection, sculpture, and tactile fabrication.

hero.alt: Mixed media installation with light projections

context.problem: Brands wanted immersive activations without the typical high-production overhead or vendor sprawl.
constraints: Tight install windows inside active retail locations
Need for modular design to tour multiple cities
Coordination across fabricators and content teams

solution.approach: Designed modular mixed-media environments that could be prototyped virtually, fabricated locally, and assembled on-site with minimal downtime.
bullets: Developed 3D previsualizations to validate flow and lighting
Created CNC-ready fabrication files and projection maps
Built reusable control systems for syncing motion, sound, and light
Documented install guides enabling local crews to execute quickly

impact.label: Install Speed
impact.description: Cut install time in half through modular kit-of-parts.

impact.label: Audience Dwell
impact.description: Average engagement time from in-person observation.

impact.label: Reuse
impact.description: Portable design deployed across four national retail tours.

process.title: Blueprint
process.description: Collaborate with brand teams to define narrative arcs and touch-points.

process.title: Prototype
process.description: Material tests, lighting studies, and interactive proof-of-concepts.

process.title: Fabricate
process.description: Produce modular components and tune projection content.

process.title: Install
process.description: Coordinate on-site crews, calibrate systems, and document runbooks.

reflection.learning: Immersive work succeeds when every component—digital or physical—shares a unified story and operational plan.
